title: Any idea what this really condensed font could be?
content:
Hi!

I´ve had this lying around for a while, and would like to use a font similar to this. Any suggestions of something similar?  
thanks!  
G

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140805130033im_/http:/typophile.com/files/djur_5022.png)
author: gabbbahey

comments.content:
Don't have the answer unfortunately. What's the sample origin BTW?  
Some alternatives for the time being: [Revolution Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20140805130033/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/flat-it/revolution-gothic)/ [Revolution Gothic P](http://web.archive.org/web/20140805130033/http:/www.hypefortype.com/browse-fonts/font-categories/condensed/revolution-gothic-p.html)/ [Revolucion PAG](http://web.archive.org/web/20140805130033/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/prop-a-ganda/pag-revolucion), [Heroic Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20140805130033/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typetrust/heroic-condensed), [Headlined Solid](http://web.archive.org/web/20140805130033/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/thinkdust/headlined-solid)/ [Healined](http://web.archive.org/web/20140805130033/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/thinkdust/headlined), [Franchise](http://web.archive.org/web/20140805130033/http:/derekweathersbee.com/franchise), [Motel Xenia](http://web.archive.org/web/20140805130033/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fenotype/motel-xenia), [Fono](http://web.archive.org/web/20140805130033/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/garagefonts/fono)

Thanks!  
A few nice alternatives there. I really like Heroic.

The sample is originally from the titles/credits of a documentary film from the mid 60s.

/G
